approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be sent.
params._data: Parameters for the contract call, such as endpoint signature.
params._spender: The contract address to spend the tokens.

basketManagerImplementation().details: getter function of basket manager implementation address

params._account: The recipient address to get the minted tokens.
params._amount: The amount of tokens to be minted.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

getChainId().details: to support EIP712, will need the token contract to return the chain id.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

massetManagerImplementation().details: getter function of MassetManager implementation address

params._account: The recipient address to get the minted tokens.
params._amount: The amount of tokens to be minted.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._basketManagerProxy: The address of the Basket Manager proxy contract

params._massetManagerProxy: The address of the MassetManager proxy contract

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

params._amount: The amount of token that will be transferred.
The amount of token that will be transferred.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

transferWithPermit(address,address,uint2.details: By calling this function, the allowance will be overwritten by the total amount.

params._amount: The amount of the token that will be transferred.

approveAndCall(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Approves and then calls the receiving contract. Useful to encapsulate sending tokens to a contract in one call. Solidity has no native way to send tokens to contracts. ERC-20 tokens require approval to be spent by third parties, such as a contract in this case.

burn(address,uint256).notice: Burns tokens for the given account.Can be burned only by the MassetManager proxy contract.

mint(address,uint256).notice: Creates new tokens and sends them to the recipient.Can be minted only by the MassetManager proxy contract.

setBasketManagerProxy(address).notice: setBasketManagerConfig sets the Basket Manager proxy address

setMassetManagerProxy(address).notice: setMassetManagerProxy sets the MassetManager proxy address

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Only owner who can transfer the token.destination cannot be: - zero (0x0) address.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Only owner who can transfer the token.destination cannot be: - zero (0x0) address.

transferWithPermit(address,address,uint2.notice: transfer utilizing EIP-2612, to reduce the additional sending transaction for doing the approval to the spender.destination cannot be: - zero (0x0) address.
